intro: Stemodia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy stemodia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other related species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves, which are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with five petals and a distinctive corolla shape. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
